AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.App
AttributeSet.Description: used to configure an App DataSource

Value.Value: App Switch
Leave blank by default (to get data from current app). If you give this an App number then the data provided by this source will come from that app. Learn more in help.
Zone Switch
If you need to access an app from another zone then set the zone number here. Note that the zone-number is not identical to the portal-id. For more help, read the instructions.

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.AttributeFilter
AttributeSet.Description: used to configure an AttributeFilter DataSource

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.Caches.CacheAllStreams
AttributeSet.Description: Configuration for CacheAllStreams data source

Value.Value: Cache All Streams Data Source
Just a nice title so you know what this cache-component should do for you. Learn more about the CacheAllStreams data source.
Refresh On Source Refresh

This is to cache things where the up-stream is already cached - for example when caching a filtered list of 2sxc-content-items. When this is set, the cache will check if the up-stream has been reloaded and if it has, then it will rebuild this cache as well. Learn more and check out best practices in help.
Cache Duration In Seconds
How long the cache will be kept / when it will be refreshed automatically. Common numbers are 86400 (1 day) or 3600 (1 hour). Learn more in help.

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.CsvDataSource
AttributeSet.Description: Configure the CSV data source.

Value.Value: Csv Data Source
Just a title to help you know what this is for. Read more in help.
File Path
File path relative to the web root, for example '/Portals/0/Data/MyMeasurements.csv'. Read the online help for more.
Value Delimiter
Delimiter of values in the rows, for example the ';', ',' or tab. Leave blank for default (i.e. the tab). Read the online help for more incl. how to add special characters like tab.
Csv Data
Content Type Name
The content type of the entities passed to the output stream. This can be an arbitrary name. See the online help for more.
Id Column Name
The case sensitive name of the column that should be used for the entity IDs. If no name is specified, the row numbers will be used for the IDs. See the online help for more.
Title Column Name
The case sensitive name of the column used for the entity titles. Leave blank to automatically take the first column. Read the online help for more.

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.EntityIdFilter
AttributeSet.Description: used to configure an EntityIdFilter DataSource

Value.Value: Comma separated list of Entity IDs, like 503,522,5066,32

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.EntityTypeFilter
AttributeSet.Description: used to configure an EntityTypeFilter DataSource

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.OwnerFilter
AttributeSet.Description: to configure the owner-filter

Value.Value: Identity Code
The identifier of the user - in DNN it could be the sequence 'dnn:userid=[User:UserId]'. Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=datasource-filter-owner

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.Paging
AttributeSet.Description: Configuration of Paging DataSources

Value.Value: Paging data source
Any title you want - for your convenience to name this. If you need any help, check out 2sxc.org/help?tag=ds-paging

Amount of items per page. By default this is 10. Also set this to the amount you want if you're using this to just get a short-list of 5 items or something - then set to 5. You could also use parameters like [QueryString:ItemsPerPage] but in general you'll probably want a number or something.

The page we're on, by default it's 1. If you only want to use the first page (like get the top 5 of something) then set 1. Otherwise use a url parameter or something - so you would use [QueryString:Page] or similar. Check out 2sxc.org/help?tag=ds-paging for more help.

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.RelationshipFilter
AttributeSet.Description: used to configure a RelationshipFilter DataSource

Value.Value: just a title so you know what it's about
your notes about this filter, to help you remember what you were thinking...

Here you can specify what relationship you are comparing for, and what value you expect in the related items. If the list contains Book items and you want to keep only those with the Author being Daniel Mettler, then you would type Author in the relationship-field and Daniel Mettler in the filter-value field.
Relationship Field
The property we're comparing. So if this is a list of books, and we want to check which ones have an Author called "Daniel", then the relationship-field is Author
Filter (on the related items)

the value we want in the related data - if you're on a book-list and only want those with the Author "Daniel", then this is where you would write Daniel. Remember that you can also use tokens, like [QueryString:Author]
Advanced Settings
Sometimes you want to use much more advanced comparisons or compare on another field than just the title.
Relationship Attribute

The field of the related items we're checking for. By default it's the title (EntityTitle), but you could also check for the ID (EntityId) or for other properties. For example, if you have a list of books and you only want to keep those of Authors who are from Switzerland, then here you would not write EntityTitle, but instead Country.
Operation / Comparison

This determines how we will compare. The following operations exist in 2sxc 9.9+:

  1. the (blank) default is the same as contains - we will check if the related items contains such an item, so if in a list of tags, one has all the mentioned tag(s)
  2. with a not-contains the related items may not contain all of the tags 
  3. if you use containsany, it will return all items where the related-items has any one of the filter criterias
  4. with a not-containsany, it will return those which don't have any of the items you listed in filter
  5. in case of a first the first item in the relationships must be what we want - this is typical for lists where the first item is like the primary category. If you specify multiple items in filter, the first will be valid if it matches any of those.
  6. in case of a not-first the first item may not match this
  7. use any it will ignore the filter-value and simply keep all items having any relationships 
  8. with not-any it will return all items not having any relationships
  9. with count it will keep all items having exactly the desired amount of related-items, the amount is specified in the filter-field
  10. if not-count it will keep all items having a different amount than the desired amount

(default = contains): contains - keep these that have all of these:contains not-contains - keep these that don't have all:not-contains containsany - keep these that have any of these:containsany not-containsany - keep these that have none of these:not-containsany first - keep these where the first item is one of these:first not-first - keep these where the first item is none of these:not-first any - keep these that have relationships:any not-any - keep these that have no relationships:not-any count - keep these with the exact child-amount in filter:count not-count - keep these with a different child amount than in filter:not-count
Separator Character

if you want to check for multiple relationships (like having multiple tags), then the filter-value will contain a string with multiple values. By default the separator is blank - so the filter-value will not be separated. Usually you would use a comma, so that you can write "online,2017,seo", but there are cases where your strings may themselves contain commas - so this is why you can specify your own separation character.
(none): comma ,:, bar / pipe |:|

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.RelationshipFilter
AttributeSet.Description: used to configure a RelationshipFilter DataSource

Value.Value: just a title so you know what it's about
your notes about this filter, to help you remember what you were thinking...

Here you can specify what relationship you are comparing for, and what value you expect in the related items. If the list contains Book items and you want to keep only those with the Author being Daniel Mettler, then you would type Author in the relationship-field and Daniel Mettler in the filter-value field.
Relationship Field
The property we're comparing. So if this is a list of books, and we want to check which ones have an Author called "Daniel", then the relationship-field is Author

the value we want in the related data - if you're on a book-list and only want those with the Author "Daniel", then this is where you would write Daniel. Remember that you can also use tokens, like [QueryString:Author]

For example, if you have a list of books and you only want to keep those of Authors who are from Switzerland, then here you would not write EntityTitle, but instead Country.

This determines how we will compare. The following operations exist in 2sxc 9.9+:

  2. with a not-contains the related items may not contain all of the tags 
  3. if you use containsany, it will return all items where the related-items has any one of the filter criterias
  4. with a not-containsany, it will return those which don't have any of the items you listed in filter
  5. in case of a first the first item in the relationships must be what we want - this is typical for lists where the first item is like the primary category. If you specify multiple items in filter, the first will be valid if it matches any of those.
  6. in case of a not-first the first item may not match this
  7. use any it will ignore the filter-value and simply keep all items having any relationships 
  8. with not-any it will return all items not having any relationships
  9. with count it will keep all items having exactly the desired amount of related-items, the amount is specified in the filter-field
  10. if not-count it will keep all items having a different amount than the desired amount

(default = contains): contains - keep these that have all of these:contains not-contains - keep these that don't have all:not-contains containsany - keep these that have any of these:containsany not-containsany - keep these that have none of these:not-containsany first - keep these where the first item is one of these:first not-first - keep these where the first item is none of these:not-first any - keep these that have relationships:any not-any - keep these that have no relationships:not-any count - keep these with the exact child-amount in filter:count not-count - keep these with a different child amount than in filter:not-count
Separator Character

if you want to check for multiple relationships (like having multiple tags), then the filter-value will contain a string with multiple values. By default the separator is blank - so the filter-value will not be separated. Usually you would use a comma, so that you can write "online,2017,seo", but there are cases where your strings may themselves contain commas - so this is why you can specify your own separation character.
(none): comma ,:, bar / pipe |:|

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.Shuffle
AttributeSet.Description: Config type for Shuffle

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.Shuffle
AttributeSet.Description: Config type for Shuffle

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.SqlDataSource
AttributeSet.Description: Config type for the Sql DataSource

Value.Value: Sql Query
just a nice name so you remember what it's for
just add some notes for yourself, so you know what the query is for and what special things you did to make it work
Connection Information
How to connect to the DB
Connection Name (preferred)
Use connection names from the web.config - DNN default is SiteSqlServer
Connection String (alternative)
alternative: write the connection string instead of the connection name
What do you want to query, and how to treat the result

SELECT TOP (1000) PortalId as EntityId, HomeDirectory as EntityTitle ,[PortalID] ,[ExpiryDate] ,[AdministratorRoleId] ,[GUID] ,[DefaultLanguage] ,[HomeDirectory] ,[CreatedOnDate] ,[PortalGroupID] FROM [Portals] Where ExpiryDate is null
SQL select statement
Content Type Name
Name of the content-type in result
Id Field
name of the ID field, if blank, defaults to EntityId
Title Field
name of the title field, if blank, defaults to EntityTitle

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.SqlDataSource
AttributeSet.Description: Config type for the Sql DataSource

Value.Value: Sql Query
just a nice name so you remember what it's for
just add some notes for yourself, so you know what the query is for and what special things you did to make it work
Connection Information
How to connect to the DB
Connection Name (preferred)
Use connection names from the web.config - DNN default is SiteSqlServer
Connection String (alternative)
alternative: write the connection string instead of the connection name
What do you want to query, and how to treat the result

SELECT TOP (1000) PortalId as EntityId, HomeDirectory as EntityTitle ,[PortalID] ,[ExpiryDate] ,[AdministratorRoleId] ,[GUID] ,[DefaultLanguage] ,[HomeDirectory] ,[CreatedOnDate] ,[PortalGroupID] FROM [Portals] Where ExpiryDate is null
SQL select statement
Content Type Name
Name of the content-type in result
Id Field
name of the ID field, if blank, defaults to EntityId
Title Field
name of the title field, if blank, defaults to EntityTitle

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.ValueFilter
AttributeSet.Description: used to configure a ValueFilter DataSource

Value.Value: The object attribute (property) we will filter on, like "FirstName" or similar. Find more help about this filter here.
The information we want to use to filter - like "John" or "[QueryString:Name]". There are many things you can do with this, so always check more information in help.

This determines how things will be compared, so if it's a "field = value" or "field contains value" etc. There are many operators and which one you use depends a bit on what data-type you are comparing. For example, a number can be "between 17 and 25" or a text can "!contain daniel". Read more about the possible operators in help.
Take / Stop after so many
Get only 1 or whatever amount you need. This improves performance if you have many thousand items, and only need a few. Leave blank to take all.

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.SexyContent.DataSources.DnnFormAndList
AttributeSet.Description: Configuration for the Form and List Data Source

Value.Value: FnL DataSource Configuration
Just a title for you to give this configuration a name.
FnL Module Id
The ID of the Form and List Module in DNN. The Data will be retrieved from that specific module.
Title Field Name
The column in Form and List which should become the title of the resulting content-items. If you leave this blank, the system will just pick the first column as title.
Content Type Name
This is the internal name for the resulting Content-Type. Usually not important, if you leave it blank a default value (usually FnL) is used.

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.SexyContent.DataSources.ModuleDataSource
AttributeSet.Description: For DNN Module DataSource

Value.Value: just a title for your own use - not important
general notes so you know what this is for - like "this is the module where the editor configures xyz-settings"
InstanceId / ModuleId
The moduleID or a token giving you the module. By default it's [Module:ModuleId]

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.SexyContent.DataSources.ModuleDataSource
AttributeSet.Description: For DNN Module DataSource

Value.Value: just a title for your own use - not important
general notes so you know what this is for - like "this is the module where the editor configures xyz-settings"
InstanceId / ModuleId
The moduleID or a token giving you the module. By default it's [Module:ModuleId]

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.SexyContent.Environment.Dnn7.DataSources.DnnFormAndList
AttributeSet.Description: Configuration for the Form and List Data Source

Value.Value: FnL DataSource Configuration
Just a title for you to give this configuration a name.
FnL Module Id
The ID of the Form and List Module in DNN. The Data will be retrieved from that specific module.
Title Field Name
The column in Form and List which should become the title of the resulting content-items. If you leave this blank, the system will just pick the first column as title.
Content Type Name
This is the internal name for the resulting Content-Type. Usually not important, if you leave it blank a default value (usually FnL) is used.

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.SexyContent.Environment.Dnn7.DataSources.DnnSqlDataSource
AttributeSet.Description: used to configure a DNN SqlDataSource

AttributeSet.Name: |Config ToSic.SexyContent.Environment.Dnn7.DataSources.DnnUserProfileDataSource
AttributeSet.Description: Configuration for DNN UserProfile DataSource

Value.Value: Title Field Name
The profile field which should define title - and will be available on the object as EntityTitle. You can always get more help here.
List the profile properties you want to provide. Typically this includes DisplayName,FirstName,LastName, etc. Remember to check the help for more guidance.
Content Type Name
An optional term for the content-type as it will be used in your program. Example: "Profile"
User IDs
Use this to limit the profiles to certain users, like "740,50603,203" - you can also use tokens of course, like [QueryString:UserId]. Leave blank to not filter by user-id.

AttributeSet.Name: App-Resources
AttributeSet.Description: Stores resources like translations for an app

AttributeSet.Name: App-Settings
AttributeSet.Description: Stores settings for an app

Value.Value: Dev-App to plan and create system content types for data-sources
Portal File System
C# Razor
Config type for the Sql DataSource

Use the SQL DataSource to get SQL data. Just write a SELECT ... FROM ... and you're good to go. 

If this is the first time you're using this, you may want some help to get started. You can find more help in the 2sxc wiki (see SqlDataSource) or in the general 2sxc help about data sources.
SQL DataSource
Portal File System
C# Razor
Configure a shuffling data-source
Use this to configure how shuffling should work. Basically just specify how many items should be returned in the end. Learn more about this in the 2sxc wiki on the Shuffle DataSource page.
Shuffle DataSource
used to configure a RelationshipFilter DataSource
This will filter the items and only return those with the relationship-requirements as configured. You can find more instructions in the 2sxc wiki about the Relationship Filter.
|Config ToSic.Eav.DataSources.RelationshipFilter
For DNN Module DataSource

This will return the items of a Module Instance, in two streams Content and ListContent. By default, it takes the module-id from the current context, but you can specify a specific module if you need it. Read more in the 2sxc wiki about the Module-Instance DataSource.
|Config ToSic.SexyContent.DataSources.ModuleDataSource
